channel.title: Question on how to make this case insensitive
channel.description:
In my yell command, I have it so if you swear, or say certain words, that it automatically mutes yu an doesn't send the message. Here is a little bit of what I have.
[code=java]else if (command.substring(5).contains("fuck") || command.substring(5).contains("Fuck") || command.substring(5).contains("fuck") || command.substring(5).contains("shit") || command.substring(5).contains("Shit")[/code]
That's saying is the text after "::yell " contrains, fuck, Fuck, shit, or Shit, that it will auto mute you. Can it be made so it's not case sensitive? If I want to completely block out the word "fuck", then I have to add in there contains("FUck"), contains("FUCk"), contains("FUCK"), etc. Is there an easier of doing this? (Besides creating an array.)

item.title: Question on how to make this case insensitive
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

hmm heres an idea, theres a method that makes your username and pass to lowercase when you login.

maybe make it so when you yell it gets turned into lowercase, then i dont think there would be a case problem.

not sure tho

Read full topic
item.source: Question on how to make this case insensitive

item.title: Question on how to make this case insensitive
item.dc:creator: @Raams Raams
item.description:
@Raams wrote:

Just use something to read all strings as lowercase for the commands.

Read full topic
item.source: Question on how to make this case insensitive

item.title: Question on how to make this case insensitive
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:4, topic:331256”]your method seems alright, but why not put all those words in a string and call it when you yell, and if it has any words in it from the string, itll just mute you, that way you can just add all the cases and it wouldnt take up too much space,

then again making it not case sensitive would be better as you would have to add alot of different version of the words (Fuck fuCk FUCK fucK etc…)

but thats your issue, you dont know how to make it non case sensitive and neither do i :o[/quote]

Well yeah… making that would be annoying as fuck though… That’s why I said anyway besides a string.

Read full topic

item.title: Question on how to make this case insensitive
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

You mean containsIgnoreCase? That doesn’t work. It’ll give me an error.

If you mean change contains to IgnoreCase, then that’ll work, but only if someone says ::yell fuck. If someone were to say ::yell fuck dadada then it wouldn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Question on how to make this case insensitive
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

In my yell command, I have it so if you swear, or say certain words, that it automatically mutes yu an doesn’t send the message. Here is a little bit of what I have.

else if (command.substring(5).contains("fuck") || command.substring(5).contains("Fuck") || command.substring(5).contains("fuck") || command.substring(5).contains("shit") || command.substring(5).contains("Shit")

That’s saying is the text after "::yell " contrains, fuck, Fuck, shit, or Shit, that it will auto mute you. Can it be made so it’s not case sensitive? If I want to completely block out the word “fuck”, then I have to add in there contains(“FUck”), contains(“FUCk”), contains(“FUCK”), etc. Is there an easier of doing this? (Besides creating an array.)

Read full topic
